result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey Tremount Wilson Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Corey Tremount Wilson Jr in court.  Attorney Erica N Young in court for Corey Tremount Wilson Jr.  Attorney Samuel Tabin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduled plea and sentencing.  Defense received additional discovery this day.  Matter remains calendared in Branch 13.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Defendant Corey Tremount Wilson Jr in court.  Attorney Erica N Young in court for Corey Tremount Wilson Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense counsel has discovery and offer from the State and needs time to discuss with client.
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/13/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Corey Tremount Wilson in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 13 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/11/2022@2:30pm
